item.title: Test #2, Question 9
item.description:
Why is the answer Case 1 instead of Case 3? The work at a level is n^2 (log (base 3) of 9) and the work of the recursion is nlogn.

Nlogn can be simplified to n.

So the work at a level is n^2 and the work of the recursion is just n. 

The work at a level is doing more work, so shouldn't it be case 3?
item.content:encoded:
Why is the answer Case 1 instead of Case 3? The work at a level is n^2 (log (base 3) of 9) and the work of the recursion is nlogn.

Nlogn can be simplified to n.

So the work at a level is n^2 and the work of the recursion is just n. 

The work at a level is doing more work, so shouldn't it be case 3?

item.title: Test #2, Question 7
item.description:
Why is the answer to question number 7 not Case 1?

The equation is T(n) = 9T(n/4) + (n^2)logn

This means that the runtime of work at a level is n^(~1.585) which is the log (base 4) of 9.

If we compare their run times then n^(1.585) < (n^2)log(n)

This means that since the recursion has a higher growth rate, it contributes more work.

So why isn't it case 1?
item.content:encoded:
Why is the answer to question number 7 not Case 1?

The equation is T(n) = 9T(n/4) + (n^2)logn

This means that the runtime of work at a level is n^(~1.585) which is the log (base 4) of 9.

If we compare their run times then n^(1.585) < (n^2)log(n)

This means that since the recursion has a higher growth rate, it contributes more work.

So why isn't it case 1?

item.title: Test Attempt 1, #9
item.description:
I'm having a hard time understanding #9

In T(n) = 2T(n/2) + n log n, the answer says it falls between cases 2 and 3.

But isn't the work done at recursion theta(n) and the work done at the level n log n? Why wouldn't it be case 3 since n is a faster run time than n log n?
item.content:encoded:
I'm having a hard time understanding #9

In T(n) = 2T(n/2) + n log n, the answer says it falls between cases 2 and 3.

But isn't the work done at recursion theta(n) and the work done at the level n log n? Why wouldn't it be case 3 since n is a faster run time than n log n?
